text: I'm Felicity Baker and this is the story
of how my grandmother hazel helped to
win the Battle of Britain when she was
the schoolgirl whatever they be my great
grandfather Fred Hill worked in the air
ministry in the mid 1930s he thought the
new Spitfires and hurricanes to carry at
least eight guns rather than the four
that been a mission he planned but he
couldn't work it out on his own so he
went home and he asked my grandmother
hazel who was a 13 year old schoolgirl
at the time and a talented mathematician
to help him work it out in air combat
the margins are very very fine and I
think it's quite reasonable to to think
that the outcome could have been quite
different many people thought eight guns
would be too many that they'd weigh down
the new planes and be impossible to fit
them on but my great-grandfather thought
otherwise six years later the Battle of
Britain eight guns was just enough to
win it and so if if we'd gone with less
if those calculations are not proving
the point you wouldn't have a big impact
for would have been really difficult
because it wouldn't give you the
firepower that we have oh no they're all
pretty glad she was able to work that
out for I spent a lot of time with my
grandmother growing up and I remember
her talking about her work on the gums
and Spitfires and hurricanes but I never
really understood what she'd done and it
was only recently when we started
looking into the story that I realized
how important her contribution had been
I'm always proud to be her granddaughter
but I'm even more so now that her works
been recognized by the RAF and by a lot
of people for the first time what a
great inspiration for young people today
young girls in particular that can look
upon someone like hazel in the early
making such a an important contribution
to our later success in the Battle of
Britain which is vital to this country's
survival
[Music]
